Title: My Social Worker. Named Social Workers Local Area Pilot & Supported Self-Assessment Pilot
Description:
The Department is running a sub OJEU Open Procurement for the services described. – (for which see ITT ref number 60277).
Interested suppliers need to register on the BMS system if they have not done so already. Details of registration can be found on the attached instructions document and link provided.
The Department of Health is seeking tenders for the monitoring and assistance with the delivery of a pilot scheme to work nationally with a range of local areas as pilot sites to design and test an effective operating model for Named Social Workers for people with learning disabilities or autism who may have mental health conditions. This will require Local Areas, with support from the successful organisation to innovate and test in practice key elements including the role, intended recipients, required support, processes, outputs and outcomes.
Contact Address 1: DH Procurement Services, Quarry House, Quarry Hill
Attachments: 2._DH_Appendix_A_Terms_of_the_Procurement.docx 1._DH_Invitation_to_Tender My Social Worker.docx BMS e-tendering manual.pdf 3AppendixBServiceDescription.docx 4._DH_Appendix_C_Short_Form_Agreement_for_Services.docx 5._DH_Appendix_D_Response_Guidance_1.docx
Additional Text:
The Department is running a sub OJEU Open Procurement for the services described. – (for which see ITT ref number 60277).

This procurement exercise will be completed via the Authority's eTendering portal (BMS) and Potential Bidders wishing to be considered for this (or any other) Authority contract must submit their response via BMS https://www.gov.uk/government/organisations/department-of-health/about/procurement

The BMS reference number for this exercise is 60277 “My social worker”, Supporting the Management, Monitoring and Evaluation.

Interested suppliers need to register on the BMS system if they have not done so already. Details of registration can be found on the attached document and link provided.
The Department reserves the right to cancel or suspend this procurement exercise, and to not proceed to Contract. The Department will not be responsible for bid costs.
DH reserves the right to extend the initial 6 month contract for further period(s) up to a maximum of an additional 6 months; conditional upon additional funding being identified and relevant approvals being in place. 
The estimated Contract value shown excludes any optional extension periods.

Title: 142 - Community Link Worker Evaluation
Description:
Wigan Borough CCG requires an external supplier to undertake an evaluation of the Community Link Worker service. The evaluation programme is expected to commence in January/ February 2016 and be delivered over a period of approximately 3-4 months. There is flexibility with regard to timescales, and we expect the supplier to work with the CCG and partners to determine the evaluation programme timetable and methodology.
1.2 The key objectives of the evaluation are as follows:
To understand the impacts of the Community Link Worker intervention on services users and their families. To understand the impact of the Community Link Worker service on general practice, acute settings, adult social care and voluntary & community organisations. To assess the extent to which the Community Link Worker service is delivering the anticipated benefits identified through the original business case. To describe and review referral pathways, criteria and service user characteristics in order to inform and shape the service model.
Additional Text:
Expressions of interest will be assessed against the bidder?s knowledge and understanding of the subject area, relevant experience and track record, proposed methodology & approach and value for money.
Expressions of interest in delivering the evaluation must be submitted to:
Claire Roberts
Assistant Director for Strategy & Collaboration
Claire.roberts@wiganboroughccg.nhs.uk
To arrive by no later than noon, 7th January 2016. No quote received after this time and date will be considered.

Service delivery within the Wigan Borough.
